file_content.text: Please leave. I can't risk being seen with you.
I hope those stockpiles buy our freedom. Good luck.
I see Tai Cordan picks his negotiators well. That should wipe your presence from the droids' memory.
Director Fenn, Troida. I've been considering Tai Cordan's offer. Given that we risk Darth Lachris's anger if we are caught, we want a special favor.
What kind of favor?
Let me hear it, first.
I have nothing that would be of value to Balmorra's corporations.
But I can't offer anything.
You do, you just don't realize it.
I wasn't informed you would be making demands of me.
Tai didn't mention "favors."
Tai isn't aware of this.
The Jedi have sometimes opposed our more... unconventional weapons. Your "ethics" cost us credits.
The anguish of the scientist. Burdened with petty--I mean, always vigilant against evil.
If we support Tai, I want a promise that the Jedi won't interfere with our weapons development.
Companies like yours need the conscience of the Jedi.
We "interfere" for a reason.
Still, that is the price of our help.
Such matters must be decided by the Jedi Council.
That's outside my authority.
But you speak for your Council, don't you?
Balmorra's in peril, and you're wheeling and dealing?
This is no time for blackmail.
We're risking our lives--all we want is a tiny concession.
Wait, that's... the Imperial soldier monitoring those droids. Stay here, I'll... tell him something.
Thought he'd never leave. I have information for you.
How did you know he'd gone anywhere?
Are you spying on me?
Imperials use that record vault. Monitoring devices help me ambush them.
Tell me.
Your interference is becoming tiresome, Zenith.
Stop interrupting my work.
Just being helpful.
Seems Director Fenn has a wife and daughter in Sobrik. My men know where to find them.
Mention that, and Fenn will agree to anything.
I can handle this without threatening innocent people.
Leave his family alone.
Innocent? He's an Imperial collaborator. But, your decision.
I'll... keep that in mind.
Better than wasting time arguing with him.
Good idea.
You're welcome. Better go.
There. The Empire suspects nothing. So, can you promise the Jedi will not interfere with our work?
If that is the price of your support, we must pay it.
I must agree.
Good. I'll inform the other directors immediately.
How about instead, we send just a few Jedi overseers? It would please the Council and be good for your image.
We can scale back.
Yes. In fact, that could boost our sales considerably. Here, a small token of our goodwill.
Now. When the Empire invaded, we hid stockpiles of arms, secret blueprints, credit accounts. They're now yours--and Tai's.
I'm sure Tai will find a good use for them.
Most generous.
I imagine those stockpiles could have bought the Empire's goodwill, if necessary.
Unused Imperial bribes?
We thought it wise to be prepared.
I hear your wife and daughter are in Sobrik. Unprotected. The Jedi can assure their... safety.
I can get your family.
What? Ah, yes. Very well, Jedi. We'll help Tai Cordan.
We've hidden stockpiles from the Empire: weapons, blueprints, credit accounts. They're all yours.
I regret this became necessary, but it's for the good of Balmorra.
Thank you. I'm sorry.
How can I find these stockpiles?
Hid them where?
Next time, don't let greed affect your judgment.
You brought this on yourself.
Please, forgive my previous thoughtlessness.
This password will let you access terminals in Sobrik to get data on the stockpiles, but that data is encrypted.
Once you have all the data, take it to the Sunken Sarlacc cantina in Sobrik. A cyborg there, Benx, can decrypt and transmit it for you, just... treat him gently.
If Tai has more people like you, facing up to Darth Lachris should be easy. Goodbye.
Thank you, Jedi. Defying Darth Lachris has been quite the adventure.
Watch out for the droids!
